sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As Russian troops move to secure the Donbass region and Ukraine, the port city of Mariupol lies in ruins with thousands of people still trapped inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some Eastern European nations are partnering up to reduce Russia's pressure on the gas market and end the EU's dependence on the Russian supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis issues a new mandate to his Sex Abuse Advisory Commission to open special victim welcome centers and audit the church's progress on fighting abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The United Nations are looking to broker an evacuation of civilians from the ruins of Mariupol. According to the local mayor, the situation at the Azov Stal Steelworks is dire. Around 3,000 people are still holed up at the plant, 2,000 of those are Ukrainian defenders. And around 100,000 people remain trapped at the sea port.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian president says what's left of the city is shocking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the city, which used to be one of the most developed in the region, there is simply a Russian concentration camp among the ruins. The rules of the occupiers in the part of Mariupol that is unfortunately under their control at the moment do not differ much from what the Nazis did in the captured territories in Eastern Europe. Meanwhile, the Pentagon's press secretary John Kirby accuses Russian President Vladimir Putin of brutality and depravity.

sentences.sentence: It's difficult to look at the...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sorry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's difficult to look at some of the images and imagine that any well-thinking serious mature leader would do that so i can't talk to a psychology but i think we can all speak to his depravity however russian president vladimir putin said his main focus is to ensure russia's security and provide his people in the Donbass with aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He made his comments whilst chairing a meeting with the Russian Security Council on Friday.

sentences.sentence: The number of people fleeing have dropped due to lack of humanitarian corridors.

sentences.sentence: But those who managed to escape the Russian occupation go to Zaporizhia.

sentences.sentence: occupation go to Zaporizhia. Radio Liberty producer Vera Hirich died after a Russian missile strike hit the residential

sentences.sentence: The editorial board of Radio Liberty extended its condolences to her family.

At least seven journalists have been killed in Ukraine since the start of the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A natural gas pipeline between the Greek-Bulgarian borders should be ready by June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's the European Union's latest efforts to ease their reliance on a Russian supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The gas interconnector Greece-Bulgaria pipeline aims to complement the existing European network.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It will provide the two countries and their neighbours access to new grid connections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The ICGB pipeline, which stands for Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria, is a high-pressure steel pipeline to transfer natural gas from the system of natural gas pipeline of Greece into the natural gas pipeline the system of natural gas pipeline of Greece into the natural gas pipeline system of Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Bulgarian and Romanian leaders also announced plans to work together to reduce Russia's pressure on the gas market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Bulgarian prime minister says they could take gas from Romania and send it towards Turkey and also back the other way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria is also looking to Azerbaijan as a possible source of gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Poland and the Czech Republic will restart their talks on building the Stork 2 gas pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The discussions were previously abandoned, but both countries are now open to energy cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It follows the Czech Republic being more than 90% dependent on Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Montenegro has a new pro-Western and pro-EU government that promises to speed up EU integration of the small and deeply divided Balkan country. But Montenegro still remains split between groups favoring pro-Western policies and those seeking closer ties with Serbia and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The government of Prime Minister Dmitry Abasovic won support from 45 lawmakers and the 81-member parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Pro-Serbian groups did not attend the session.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This vote comes just weeks after the previous pro-Serbian government was ousted back in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The vote concluded the process of the removal of former prime minister, Sr. Krivokopis, who came to power in 2020 with huge support of the Serbian Orthodox Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He lost the confidence vote in early February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The term of the new government, as earlier announced, could be one year, which means that the early parliamentary election might be held in the spring of 2023. However, many people in the country think that this term could be extended. Stefan Goranovich, Euronews, Podgorica, Montenegro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The head of the EU's border agency confirmed he's stepping down on Friday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: following reports of misconduct and human rights violations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Fabrice Leggeri was appointed to the head of Frontex in 2015, as the bloc was dealing with an influx of migrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His resignation was revealed by several sources, including a journalist from Lighthouse Reports, an investigative organization that highlighted accusations of pushbacks, the illegal practice of forcing back migrants who have reached E.U. territory, whether on land or at sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: ANTONIO PASQUALE, Journalist, Lighthouse Reports, Frontex, France Frontex says basically every time the same thing. They claim that they do not have to investigate on an action perpetrated by a European country. And all they can do is they provide the help in this operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, the Greek government claimed that these allegations were not true, but did not provide any details about or any explanation to explain why those people were found in a life shaft in the middle of the sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT In a statement, Leggeri said it seemed to him that the management board of Frontex had silently but effectively changed the mandate on which he was elected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the European Union denied the mandate had changed. Pope Francis hopes to audit progress on tackling abuse within the Catholic Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The pontiff has given a new mandate to a sex abuse advisory commission, asking the members to work with bishops globally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It follows decades of revelations of priests raping and molesting children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For the first time, the Holy Father has placed the importance of child protection as a core of the Church's central government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We thanked him for his constant support, and the Holy Father told us that the autonomy of the Commission is meant to ensure the integrity of its expertise and especially in its freedom to give advice to the Holy Father on these delicate matters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: One of the Commission's biggest initial recommendations was a special Vatican tribunal to prosecute bishops who covered up for paedophiles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But it went nowhere, frustrating survivors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Pope hopes by creating special welcome centres for victims, it could help answer long-standing complaints from individuals about the reports of abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: City authorities in the Spanish capital Madrid have decided to cut the frequency of metro trains

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: because of a soaring cost of electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The system used to cost them 120,000 euros a day for power, but it's gone up by over five times to 830,000. There are also around 20% fewer passengers using the metro compared to pre-pandemic levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Obviously, in a context in which the price per megawatt hour is so high, this measure, in addition to adapting supply to demand, will mean cost benefits for the Madrid metro.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the idea hasn't gone down well with opposition politicians in the city's local assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're seeking a meeting with the president of the community of Madrid, Isabel Ayuso.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This means one out of every ten trains won't come, so there'll be 900 fewer trains per day, which means waiting time is going to go from three to seven minutes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mrs Ayuso is effectively robbing the people of Madrid of 6,000 hours of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Madrid metro is one of the largest in Europe, with over 300 stations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Like many other countries, Spain is having to cope with soaring energy prices due to the recovery after the pandemic and made worse by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
